eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Health
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Manage health (life) points, shield and armor.
description: Manage health (life) points, shield and armor.
It handles:
- Damage cooldown
- Health and shield regeneration
- Over healing
It can be used on:
- Players
- Enemies
- NPCs
- Inanimate objects (for insance breakable doors or mining rocks)
The top-down RPG example uses this extension ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://top-down-rpg)).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Manage health (life) points, shield and armor.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: Health

events.comment: Correct any values above maximum limits
Correct any values above maximum limits

events.name: Remove shield points if shield expired

eventsFunctions.description: Apply damage to the object. Shield and armor can reduce this damage if enabled.
eventsFunctions.name: Hit
eventsFunctions.sentence: Apply _PARAM2_ points of damage to _PARAM0_ (Damage can be reduced by Shield: _PARAM3_, Armor: _PARAM4_)

events.comment: Only consider incoming damage when damage cooldown is not active
No damage will be applied when dodged
If shield is active, damage the shield first
If damage is less than shield, subtract damage from shield.
If damage is greater than shield, conditionally apply excess damage based on property
Apply excess damage only if shield does not block excess damage

events.comment: This allows to detect a change of "intial value" on hot reload.
Pass the configuration to the behavior (MaxValue must be set before Value).

Children instances must be resized when the button size change:
- background is resized to take the full dimensions of the button
- the bar size is refreshed according to the value

The scale is set back to 1 because it means that the parent instance has the same dimensions as the union of its children instances.

eventsFunctions.description: Center the bar according to the button configuration. This is used in doStepPostEvents when the button is resized.
eventsFunctions.name: CenterBar

events.comment: The value is clamped by the behavior. This is why Object.Value() is used instead of Value directly.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Silver-Streak, @Bouh, Tristan Rhodes
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: IsOnScreen
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: This adds a condition to detect if an object is on screen based off its current layer.
description: This extension adds conditions to check if an object is located within the visible portion of its layer's camera. The condition also allows for specifying padding to the virtual screen border.
Note that this does not take into account any object visibility, such as being hidden or 0 opacity, but can be combined with those existing conditions.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
This behavior provides a condition to check if the object is located within the visible portion of its layer's camera. The condition also allows for specifying padding to the virtual screen border.
Note that object visibility, such as being hidden or 0 opacity, is not considered (but you can use those existing conditions in addition to this behavior).
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: InOnScreen

eventsFunctions.description: Checks if an object position is within the viewport of its layer.
eventsFunctions.name: IsOnScreen

inlineCode: Get the object layer, convert the position from this layer to the screen coordinates.
Get the point on each side on the object on screen, and compare with the screen area.
This way even if the camera has a rotation or custom scale the object is always compared to the screen area.
// Get the layer of the object.
// Get the aabb of the object on his layer.
// Get the layer to convert the coordinates of the AABB to the screen coordinates
// Get the points on each side of the object on screen.
const posLeftObjectOnScreen = Math.min(topLeft[0], topRight[0], bottomLeft[0], bottomRight[0]);
const posRightObjectOnScreen = Math.max(topLeft[0], topRight[0], bottomLeft[0], bottomRight[0]);
const posUpObjectOnScreen = Math.min(topLeft[1], topRight[1], bottomLeft[1], bottomRight[1]);
const posDownObjectOnScreen = Math.max(topLeft[1], topRight[1], bottomLeft[1], bottomRight[1]);

parameters.longDescription: Number of pixels to pad the screen border. Zero by default. A negative value goes inside the screen, a positive value go outside.
parameters.name: Padding

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ObjectPickingTools
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Adds various object picking related tools.
description: Adds various actions and conditions for advanced object selection. Includes picking objects with the highest or lowest zOrder, an object variable, and the ability to unpick all objects.
Note: Version 2.0.0 changed Z-order picking to pick all instances with the highest/lowest Z-order. Version 1.x.x only picked one instance.

eventsFunctions.name: PickLowestZAction

inlineCode: // Create an empty array to hold the objects with the lowest value
// Initialize the lowest value to a very small number
// Loop through each object to find the lowest value
// Get the value of the variable
// Compare and update the lowest value
lowestValueObjects = [object]; // Reset the list to contain only this new lowest value object
lowestValueObjects.push(object); // If the value is equal to the current lowest, add it to the list
// Pick all object instances with the lowest value

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Bouh
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Gamepads
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Add support for gamepads (or other controllers) to your game, giving access to information such as button presses, axis positions, trigger pressure, etc...
description: Add support for gamepads (or other controllers).
It gives access to:
- button presses
- axis positions and force
- trigger pressure
- configurable deadzone
- vibration
- automatic mappers for platformer characters and top-down movement
The Bomberman-like example handles 4 players with gamepads ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://goose-bomberman)).

inlineCode: //Define an new private object javascript for the gamepad extension
controllerButtonNames: { //Map associating controller button ids to button names
// "XINPUT" cannot be used to check if it is a xbox controller is just a generic
// name reported in Firefox corresponding to the driver being used by the controller
//Returns the new value taking into account the dead zone for the player_ID given
// Anything smaller than this is assumed to be 0,0
// In the dead zone, set to 0
// We're outside the dead zone, but we'd like to smooth
// this value out so it still runs nicely between 0..1.
// That is, we don't want it to jump suddenly from 0 to
//Each time a player press a button i save the last button pressed for the next frame
let gamepad = gamepads[i]; // Get the gamepad of the player
//We have to keep this condition because if the user hasn't plugged in his controller yet, we can't get the controller in the gamepad variable.
for (let b = 0; b < Object.keys(gamepad.buttons).length; b++) { //For each buttons
//Save the state of the button for the next frame.

events.comment: Reduce the speed to match the stick force.
Turn back at least as fast as it would stop.
Reduce the speed to match the stick force.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Arthur Pacaud (arthuro555)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: UUID
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: A collection of UID generation expressions.
description: Adds UUID (Universally Unique Identifiers) generation expressions via multiple patterns:

- UUIDv4: Creates a long random string of characters following the UUIDv4 standard. If available on the system/browser, will use a cryptographic random number generator, otherwise uses the same pseudorandom number generator as the `Random()` expression. Chances of collisions are extremely low, but not non-existent. As the return value is a string, it may not be the most performant pattern. It can not be predicted in most cases.

- Incremented integer: Returns use an integer that will be incremented after each call. Very performant and no risk of collisions. The UID will be predictable, so it may be vulnerable to some cryptographic attacks if used for private unique tokens, like password reset verification UID. Note that if you store IDs and then restart the game, there may be duplicates, since it'll reset the counter.

eventsFunctions.description: Generates a unique identifier with the UUIDv4 pattern.
eventsFunctions.name: GenerateUUIDv4

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: PanelSpriteButton
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: A button that can be customized.
description: The button can be customized with a background for each state and a label. It handles user interactions and a simple condition can be used to check if it is clicked.
There are ready-to-use buttons in the asset-store [menu buttons pack](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?initial-dialog=asset-store&asset-pack=menu-buttons-menu-buttons).

eventsBasedObjects.description: A button that can be customized.
eventsBasedObjects.name: PanelSpriteButton

events.comment:
Create one background instance for of each state.
Only the instance for the current state is shown.
Place the label over the backgrounds.
Show the right background accordingly to the new state.

Children instances must be resized when the button size change:
- backgrounds for each state are resized to take the full dimensions of the button
- the label is put back at the center of the button

The scale is set back to 1 because it means that the parent instance has the same dimensions as the union of its children instances.
